item.title: Willow trees overhanging public footpath and blocking streetlights., 28th June
item.description:
End of cul-de-sac adjacent to 132 Abbotswood Road. Issue has got steadily worse over the years as trees lean further. The footpath is used by families taking children to school. I have spoken to the person who I believe is responsible for the trees - he lives in a cottage in Watermead about 100 metres south. He promised to do something about it but despite a reminder, has failed to act. I would ask the relevant authority to use its powers under section 23 of the Local Government (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1976 to require him to do do before someone gets hurt or property is damaged. I have no powers to act on my own!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Byfield Close central grass areas are excessively long, 28th June
item.description:
Whilst I support 'no mow May', the grass in the square (two areas) has not been cut this year. It is now excessively long. It is unsightly, a hazard when exiting our drive and of course a source of pollen to hay fever sufferers. Previously the grass was regularly cut throughout the summer by Tewkesbury Borough Council. TBC advise that this is now your responsibility. Please advise if and when you intend to maintain them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Byfield Close, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain surround outside the IMJIN exit has collapsed again., 28th June
item.description:
The drain surround outside the IMJIN exit has collapsed again. Could it be repaired please ? Perhaps would it be worth trying to investigate the underlying structure to see why it keeps breaking down ? Many thanks !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
